text: How do you all handle career-pathing for the content marketing roles at your companies? We are struggling with this where I work. I have four direct reports who are all on more of the individual contributor path vs. people leader path. But there has been very little real promotion within this group. And three of the four have been with the company for 3-6 years. I feel like job titles have always been somewhat arbitrary here as well, so it's not clear to anyone what their next role could/should be.

elements.text: How do you all handle career-pathing for the content marketing roles at your companies? We are struggling with this where I work. I have four direct reports who are all on more of the individual contributor path vs. people leader path. But there has been very little real promotion within this group. And three of the four have been with the company for 3-6 years. I feel like job titles have always been somewhat arbitrary here as well, so it's not clear to anyone what their next role could/should be.

text:
In general (not knowing more), they should continue to grow into more senior content maketing IC roles (senior manager, strategist, director, principal, etc.) as they become more adept and can take on more themselves, don’t need editing/oversifht.
They should be growing based on results they drive, strategies they create and execute, or the new types of media/content they create and take on. They could also specialize in a type of content (one could own customer comms, case studies, and CS focused support with their own metrics and goals; another sales enablement or and/or product messaging; one focused on TOFU/brand/PR plays) Just a few ideas to get your started on where they could go!
